skill.name: github-code-review
skill.description: Comprehensive GitHub code review with AI-powered swarm coordination
skill.summary: Comprehensive GitHub code review with AI-powered swarm coordination
skill.author: Claude Code Flow

security_audit.summary: Pure documentation skill containing only markdown guidance. No executable code, file system access, or network operations. All external command references are within example documentation only.

content.user_title: Review code with AI swarm agents
content.value_statement: Code reviews require manual effort and may miss security issues or performance problems. This skill coordinates multiple AI agents to review pull requests across security, performance, style, and architecture dimensions simultaneously.
actual_capabilities: Deploys specialized AI agents for security, performance, style, and architecture reviews
Analyzes pull requests using GitHub CLI integration
Generates contextual review comments with severity levels
Supports custom review agents and quality gate configuration
Integrates with GitHub Actions for automated review workflows
limitations: Requires GitHub CLI (gh) and ruv-swarm tools to be installed
Cannot execute code or run tests directly
Review quality depends on AI model capabilities and context provided
Labels and comments require appropriate GitHub permissions

use_cases.title: Multi-agent security review
use_cases.description: Deploy security-focused AI agents to analyze pull requests for vulnerabilities before merging

use_cases.title: Automated PR quality gates
use_cases.description: Set up automated review workflows that check code quality, style, and documentation standards

use_cases.title: CI/CD review integration
use_cases.description: Integrate AI-powered code review into GitHub Actions pipelines for continuous quality assurance

prompt_templates.title: Basic PR review
prompt_templates.prompt: Use the github-code-review skill to review PR 123 for security issues and code quality. Post the results as a comment.

prompt_templates.title: Security-focused review
prompt_templates.prompt: Run a security-only review on PR 456 using the security review agent. Check for OWASP vulnerabilities and suggest fixes.

prompt_templates.title: Performance analysis
prompt_templates.prompt: Analyze PR 789 with the performance review agent. Identify bottlenecks and suggest optimizations with benchmarks.

prompt_templates.title: Complete swarm review
prompt_templates.prompt: Initiate a comprehensive review on PR 321 using security, performance, style, and architecture agents. Post all findings to the PR.

output: High: 2 issues found - SQL injection risk in database queries (lines 45-52)
Medium: 5 issues found - Input validation, error handling improvements needed
All findings have been posted as review comments on the PR.

best_practices: Configure quality gates with clear thresholds for blocking merges on critical issues
Use label-based agent assignment to route PRs to appropriate specialized reviewers
Combine AI reviews with human oversight for final approval decisions
anti_patterns: Relying solely on AI reviews without human verification of critical changes
Ignoring severity classifications and treating all issues as equally important
Running reviews on very large PRs without incremental or focused review modes

faq.question: Which AI tools support this skill?
faq.answer: This skill works with Claude, Codex, and Claude Code. Each may have different review capabilities.

faq.question: What are the rate limits for GitHub API calls?
faq.answer: GitHub API limits apply to all operations. The skill uses gh CLI which handles rate limit errors gracefully.

faq.question: Can I integrate this with existing CI/CD tools?
faq.answer: Yes. The skill includes GitHub Actions workflow examples that integrate with any CI/CD pipeline.

faq.question: Is my code data sent to external services?
faq.answer: Code is processed locally by AI tools you configure. Only GitHub API calls are made to your repository.

faq.question: Why are no review comments appearing on my PR?
faq.answer: Check GitHub token permissions (needs repo scope), verify gh CLI authentication, and review API rate limits.

faq.question: How does this compare to GitHub Copilot code review?
faq.answer: This skill coordinates multiple specialized agents for comprehensive review. Copilot provides inline suggestions during coding.
